dt: {bc}the omission of one or more words that are obviously understood but that must be supplied to make a construction grammatically complete
{bc}a sudden leap from one topic to another
{bc}marks or a mark (such as … ) indicating an omission (as of words) or a pause

et: Latin, from Greek {it}elleipsis{/it} ellipsis, ellipse, from {it}elleipein{/it} to leave out, fall short, from {it}en{/it} in + {it}leipein{/it} to leave {ma}{mat|in|}, {mat|loan|}{/ma}
shortdef: the omission of one or more words that are obviously understood but that must be supplied to make a construction grammatically complete
a sudden leap from one topic to another
marks or a mark (such as … ) indicating an omission (as of words) or a pause
